results.title: The Closet = Le Placard [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Francis Veber, Alain Poire, Canal+, EFVE, Gaumont-British Instructional and TF1 Films productions
results.brief_description: The Closet is a farcical French comedy from writer/director Francis Veber (The Dinner game, Les Fugitifs, The Birdcage). Francois Pignon (Daniel Auteuil) is an accountant in a rubber factory, where he is regarded as boring, insignificant, disposable and ‘unmanly’. Pignon, estranged from his ex-wife and teenage son, is about to be fired, an event that he regards as catastrophic. His response to his impending unemployment is attempted suicide until his new neighbour (Michel Aumont) talks him out of that plan and into another - if Pignon pretends he is gay the company will not fire him for fear of seeming homophobic. The effects on Pignon’s life, of his decision to come out of the closet, are enormous and ricochet into the lives of family and colleagues. “The Closet” explores notions of homophobia, machismo, discrimination, work place relationships and sexuality in a comedic manner. Stars some of France’s finest actors - Daniel Auteuil, Gerard Depardieu, Michele Laroque, Thierry Lhermitte and Jean Rochefort. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Nurse Betty [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Neil LaBute, Gail Mutrux, Steve Golin, AB'-Strakt Pictures, IMF (DE), Propaganda Films and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Nurse Betty is a black comedy directed by Neil LaBute (In the company of men, Your friends and neighbours). Renee Zellweger (Bridget Jones’s diary) stars as Betty Sizemore, a big-hearted waitress living in Fair Oakes, Kansas with her boorish, abusive, cheating husband Del (Aaron Eckhart). Unbeknownst to Betty, Del is involved in some shady business dealings. One night when Betty is engrossed in her favourite soap, “A Reason to love”, Del is crudely murdered by two hit men, Wesley (Chris Rock) and Charlie (Morgan Freeman). Rather than believe reality, Betty believes the screen and goes off in search of her long lost love ‘Dr David Ravell’, the main character on her favourite show. The two hit men who killed her husband, each of whom make very different assumptions about their prey, pursue Betty across country. Once in LA, Betty strikes up a friendship with Rosa (Tia Texada) who reluctantly helps her track down her mythical doctor, played by Greg Kinnear. Renee Zellweger is funny and convincing as the naive, Betty, and won Best Actress in a comedy/musical at the Golden Globes, 2001.

results.title: A Lonely woman = Kobieta Samotna [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Agnieszka Holland, Telewizja Polska S A and Zespol Filmowy "X"
results.brief_description: Banned in Poland due to its candid representation of the bleakness of life under socialism, “A Lonely Woman” is one of Holland’s most powerful films and her last prior to her exile in France. Irena is a lonely middle-aged women and single mother living in poverty in a small Polish town. Deprived of help and friendship, she has little contact with anyone apart from her son on whom she dotes. One day while on her mail round, she meets a crippled young miner named Jacek and a love affair gradually develops between the couple based on their mutual loneliness. Irena’s circumstances become even more dire when the sick relative she has been caring for dies and she is faced with the funeral costs rather than the inheritance she expected. In desperation she steals the pensioners’ money that she is supposed to deliver, puts her son in a boarding school, buys a car and heads to West Berlin with Jacek. Yet in a surprise plot twist the couple’s getaway takes an alarming turn. Cast includes Maria Chwalibog, and Boguslaw Linda. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Bad luck = Zezowate szczescie [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Munk and Zespol Filmowy Kamera
results.brief_description: This highly amusing and barbed Polish satire recounts twenty years in the life of Jan Piszczyk, a hapless everyman, whose life is marred by misfortune and bad timing. In an extended flashback sequence Jan first tells of his harassment at the hands of taunting schoolboys, and a disastrous spell at boy scouts. Despite living with his dismissive and draconian father, Jan senses the tide has turned when he falls for a student he is tutoring. But alas it is not to be - his romantic life is marred by accidental involvement in student fascist politics and he is harassed continuously when mistaken for a Jew. Jan joins the army, in the hope of impressing women but is called up when WWII erupts, erroneously arrested when he dons another’s uniform, and mercilessly ridiculed and ostracised when taken for a spy by fellow POWs. Jan’s failure at adaptation, in a rapidly changing world, leads to increasing alienation from his fellow man and a continuous lament at his fate or ‘bad luck’ that dogs him. With an episodic structure, and utilising an inventive soundscape, not dissimilar to that of Jacques Tati, the film establishes a gently mocking tone that is not only humorous but also decidedly sardonic. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: One true thing
results.creator_credit: Carl Franklin, Harry Ufland, Jesse Beaton, Monarch Pictures, Ufland Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: One true thing depicts relationships among one ordinary American family as they grapple with emerging truths as a result of terminal illness. Ellen, an ambitious but somewhat frosty Harvard graduate working at ‘New York Magazine’ as a writer, is dominated by her father, George, a literary professor and critic and her mother, Kate, a homemaker and perfectionist who reflects the middle-America values and priorities that Ellen scorns. With Kate unwell, George asks that Ellen return home as carer - a role which Ellen resents, as it will take her away from her boyfriend and literary career in New York. “One true thing”, a high-brow tearjerker, utilises melodrama to portray the central conflict of the family that is always subtly at war with itself. At times turgid and predictable the drama is nevertheless effective, mostly due to the strong performances of the three lead actors as they portray adults bourgeoning with thwarted desires and misplaced loyalties. Cast includes Meryl Streep, Renee Zelweger and William Hurt.

results.title: The Glenn Miller story
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mann, Aaron Rosenberg and Universal International Pictures
results.brief_description: This bio-pic is the story of legendary (real-life) American big band leader Glenn Miller. Miller was a visionary who introduced swing music to American audiences in the 1940s with his own original compositions. Starting in the 1930s “The Glen Miller story” tracks Miller’s struggles to have his arrangements played when the mood of the day was for the standards only. Miller was a talented trombonist who was driven by a love of music to champion the case for a new style of writing. The film also tells the story of Miller wooing his teenage sweetheart, whom he eventually marries. Helen (June Allyson) frequently played second fiddle to Miller’s ambitions, even spending her wedding night at a club whilst Miller jammed with Louis Armstrong. The film features many musicians of the era playing themselves which greatly enhances its appeal. Musicians include: Louis Armstrong, Gene Krupa, Barney Biggard, Arvell Shaw and Frances Langford. “The Glenn Miller story” was one of the most successful bio-pics of its day. Starring James Stewart as Miller, the film was nominated for five Academy Awards in 1954, winning one for best sound.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Columbus, David Heyman, 1492 Pictures, Heyday Films and Warner Bros Pictures
results.description: A stunning visual adaptation of the novel of the same name by British author J.K. Rowling. Ten year old Harry Potter, orphaned as an infant and raised by his horrible aunt and uncle, believes himself to be an ordinary boy, only to find out on his eleventh birthday that he is anything but ordinary. Harry is a wizard and has been accepted at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where he will spend the next seven years following in his parent’s footsteps. Spells, charms, potions, Quidditch - every young wizard’s favourite sport, dragons, trolls, three-headed dogs and discovering the truth behind his parent’s not-so-accidental death means never-ending adventures for Harry and his friends Hermione and Ron. Newcomers Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint star as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Cast also includes Richard Harris, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis.

results.title: Best in show
results.creator_credit: Christopher Guest, Karen Murphy and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Director Christopher Guest and cast members from his previous film ‘Waiting for Guffman’ reunite in this mockumentary following the exploits of five dogs and their handlers before the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show. Guest himself plays Harlan Pepper, a fly-fishing store owner and amateur ventriloquist, who decides to enter his beloved bloodhound Hubert in the prestigious competition. His competition includes “Winky”, a Norwich terrier, owned by neurotic couple Gerry and Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O’Hara) and “Beatrice” a high-strung Wiemaraner owned by preppy couple Meg and Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock). Also making the trip to Philadelphia are Scott (John Michael Higgins) and Stefan (Michael McKean), life-partners from New York and their beloved Shih Tzu “Miss Agnes”, and trophy wife Sheri Ann Cabot (Jennifer Coolidge) and her friend and dog trainer, Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch) and their poodle, two time ‘Mayflower Best in Show’ winner, “Rhapsody in White”, also known as Butch. Cast also includes Fred Willard, Bob Balaban, Ed Begley Jr and Lewis Arquette.

Harry is a wizard and has been accepted at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where he will spend the next seven years following in his parent’s footsteps. Spells, charms, potions, Quidditch - every young wizard’s favourite sport, dragons, trolls, three-headed dogs and discovering the truth behind his parent’s not-so-accidental death means never-ending adventures for Harry and his friends Hermione and Ron. Newcomers Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint star as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Cast also includes Richard Harris, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis.

results.title: A Hungarian fairy tale = Hol volt, Hol nem volt [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Gyula Gazdag, Lajos Ovari, Hungarofilm and Objective Productions
results.brief_description: This strange, beautifully realised, almost wordless film combines gritty social realism and symbolic poeticism to tell the story of a boy’s fruitless search for his father. The film begins with a highly romantic scene in which a beautiful young woman and a handsome stranger meet at a performance of ‘The Magic Flute,’—an encounter that results in a passionate one-night-stand and the birth of a child. Though the father is never heard of again, Hungarian law states that every child must, by the age of three, have a father’s name entered on their birth certificate. The woman, with the encouragement of the bureaucrat who completes the form for her, invents a fictional name, address and occupation for the father. Years later, after his mother’s untimely death, the boy, now in his teens, sets out to find his mythic father. Beginning as a satire about Hungarian bureaucracy, the film introduces surreal and comic elements as the boy’s journey progresses. Eventually it evolves into a provocative allegorical fantasy about Hungarian identity and politics. Features a particularly strong performance by David Vermes as the teenage boy and impressive black and white photography. Cast also includes Maria Varga, Frantisek Husak and Eszter Csakanyi.
